elphem.elph.electron_phonon module

class elphem.elph.electron_phonon.ElectronPhonon(electron: Electron, phonon: Phonon, temperature: float, sigma: float = 0.001, eta: float = 0.0005, effective_potential: float = 0.0625, n_bands: int = 1)[source]

Bases: object

Calculate the electron-phonon interactions.

temperature

Temperature of the system in Kelvin

Type:

float

sigma

Smearing parameter for the Gaussian distribution, defaults to 0.001 Hartree

Type:

float

eta

Small positive constant to ensure numerical stability, defaults to 0.0005 Hartree

Type:

float

effective_potential

Effective potential used in electron-phonon coupling calculation, defaults to 0.0625

Type:

float

n_bands

Number of bands for calculating self energies

Type:

int

electron

Free electron for initial and final states

Type:

Electron

electron_inter

Free electron for intermediate states

Type:

Electron

phonon

Debye Phonon

Type:

Phonon

green_function

Green function

Type:

GreenFunction

couplings

electron-phonon coupling constants squared

Type:

np.ndarray

calculate_coupling_strengths(delta_omega: float = 1e-06) → ndarray[source]

Calculate electron-phonon coupling strengths

Parameters:

delta_omega (float, optional) – A small value used for numerical differentiation. Defaults to 0.000001 Hartree.

Returns:

A numpy array of coupling strengths

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_couplings() → ndarray[source]

Calculate the lowest-order electron-phonon coupling constants.

Returns:

The lowest-order electron-phonon coupling constants

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_electron_phonon_renormalization() → ndarray[source]

Calculate electron-phonon renormalizations of electron eigenenergies (EPR).

Returns:

A numpy array of EPR

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_self_energies(omega: float) → ndarray[source]

Calculate Fan self-energies.

Parameters:

omega (float) – a frequency.

Returns:

A numpy array of Fan self-energies.

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_self_energies_over_range(omega_array: ndarray | list[float]) → ndarray[source]

Calculate self energies over a given array of frequencies.

Parameters:

omega_array (np.ndarray | list[float]) – a numpy array or list of frequencies

Returns:

a numpy array of self energies

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_spectrum(omega: float) → ndarray[source]

Calculate the spectral function for a frequency.

Parameters:

omega (float) – a frequency

Returns:

A numpy array of the spectral function at omega Hartree

Return type:

np.ndarray

calculate_spectrum_over_range(omega_array: ndarray | list[float], normalize: bool = False) → ndarray[source]

Calculate spectral function over a given array of frequencies.

Parameters:

  • omega_array (np.ndarray | list[float]) – A numpy array or list of frequencies

  • normalize (bool, optional) – Flag for normalizing spectral functions. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A numpy array of spectral functions

Return type:

np.ndarray

create_ggkq_grid(electron: Electron, phonon: Phonon) → tuple[source]

Create (G_!, G_2, k, q) combined grids

Parameters:

  • electron (Electron) – Free electron

  • phonon (Phonon) – Debye phonon

Returns:

(G_1, G_2, k, q) combined grids

Return type:

tuple
